p.s: In order to make the article more appealing, Worne uses a lot of stylistic devices and communicative strategies.
You can find one in the Headlineheadline: can't, won't, don't Headlineheadline.
This is not only an exaggeration but also a climax.
Using this in the headline attracts attention to the article.
In addition, it brings humor in the article since it seems a little bit defiant.
Using this phrase in line 1 to sum something up has the same effect.
But this is not the only time John Worne uses humor.
In lines 18 to 23 he uses also sarcasm.
By doing that while countering arguments he shows that thesthese arguments are Nonsensenonsense and that he is tired of hearing these.
Using Cobblers (l. 23), an informal word, he makes the article more appealing for the reader.
In order to create tension he uses a climax (l. 25-27), which also stresses the last part of the climax.
John Worne uses a lot of studies and numbers to underline his point of view.
This makes the think, that he has alota lot of background knowledge about this topic and did research.
The same effect has that he uses little informal language.
By refusing counterarguments (l. 19-23), he convinces the reader.
The use of examples in addition to this, not only there, is more convincing.
In the last paragraph (l. 46-51) he adressesaddresses the reader directly to do something.
This leads to action of the reader.
In the end it could be said that the the author uses a lot of stylistic devices, examples, studies and humor to convince the reader.
